result.execSummary:
The defendant Taurus C Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution for Waukesha County Risk Management to be paid as a condition of probation on case 20CF1432.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation on case 20CF01432.

With Huber. Release for employment, treatment and Probation appointments. Commencing forthwith. Sentence credit of 37 days were granted. 
May transfer to Milwaukee County, but NO Electronic Monitoring.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 06/27/2022 Motion for Postconviction Relief Hearing in front of Judge Schimel, filed by Court Reporter Anjanette Klein

Attorney Jay R Pucek has been appointed as appellate counsel.

Record in this case does not contain any filings not subject to electronic filing.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 09/18/2022

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 09/22/2022 - No court action on this communication.**
IT IS ORDERED that the time for appointing counsel and ordering transcripts is extended to thirty days from the date of this order. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.82(2)(a).
COPY: Motion to Extend the Time for Appointing Postconviction Counsel and Ordering Transcripts filed with the Court of Appeals by Atty. Ehmann.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 09/13/2022
Response from the Clerk dated 08/29/2022 regarding Defendant's request for early release

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form undated - requesting early release due to health concerns

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 08/29/2022 - Court will not act on this request as there is insufficient information provided to even consider the request.**
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 7/20/2022 from defendant reiterating the terms of his judgments of conviction.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 7/18/2022 from defendant regarding the structure of his sentence.

Court of Appeals Order:  IT IS ORDERED that the WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30 appeal rights are reinstated.  The time for filing a notice of intent to pursue postconviction relief is extended to June 29, 2022.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the time to act under either WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30(2)(e) or (f) commences as of the date of this order.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, within five days of the date of this order, Attorney Ted Szcupakiewicz shall either opt in to participate in the Court of Appeals electronic filing system for this case or provide this court with an explanation for not doing so.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 7/2/2022 from defendant regarding potential for early release.
Clerk's response to the Defendant's Notice of Intent to Pursue Postconviction Relief - Sent to the State Public Defender's Office - Appellate Division.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 6/27/2022 from defendant regarding his custody status.
Defendant's Notice of Intent To Pursue Postconviction or Postdisposition Relief.
records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Copy of:  Motion For An Extension  Of Time For Filing The Defendant's Notice of Intent to Seek Postconviction Relief, Sent to Court of Appeals.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Abigail Kincholoe, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Taurus C Hill in court, in custody, with attorney Priya Barnes (as friend of the court). 
Court to Address:  Defendant's Pro-Se Postconviction Motion for Sentence Modification - To allow for Electronic Monitoring.

Court originally ordered the defendant's sentence be served with huber, however, the jail is refusing to classify him as huber eligible on his 22CF680.
Defendant presented statements to the court.
Court explained to the defendant that the court can't order the jail to finds someone eligible for huber privileges.
Court has already authorized transferred to Milwaukee County to serve his huber if they are willing to take him, however, court will not allow Electronic Monitoring.  That is already noted in the JOC.
Court will not modify the sentence in anyway at this time.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing on June 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 6/13/2022 from defendant requesting to be released on electronic monitoring.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 6/16/2022 - Set for a hearing.**
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 6/2/2022 from defendant.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 5/31/2022 from defendant.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 5/30/2022 from defendant.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 5/27/2022 from defendant.

Letter from Jail Administration requesting Huber privileges be revoked for 60 days.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 5/26/2022 - The Court was aware at sentencing of defendant's poor behavior in the jail. That was part of why he was held without release pending sentencing. The Court acknowledges the Sheriff's authority to make classification decisions within the jail, but the defendant maintaining employment was a factor in the sentencing structure, so the Court declines to revoke Huber.**

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 05/17/22 regarding discovery, defense counsel and time in custody and Huber.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 5/19/2022 - I decline to grant good time credit on the condition time. If the defendant has additional credit to which he believes he is entitled, he will need to provide more specific details.**

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form (undated) requesting transfer of Huber to Milwaukee County House of Corrections.

  **Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 05/18/2022--Approved for transfer of Huber to Milwaukee County House of Corrections; denied as to request for Electronic Monitoring.  An Amended Judgment of Conviction is to be prepared.**

LF 5/18--sent to Case.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

11:15 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Taurus C Hill in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Priya Barnes.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and confirms with parties they are prepared to proceed to plea and sentencing.  State has complied with victim rights to proceed today.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Barnes confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  Court orders Counts 2 & 3 dismissed and read in.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Barnes.


COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed Sentence of:

9 Months Huber with realease for employment, treatment, and Probation & Parole appointments.  (Credit - 37 days).  Sentence commences immediately.

RESTITUTION: $890.00 to be paid to Waukesha County Risk Management;

COSTS:  $243.00;

DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation as ordered in case 20CF1432. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

10:36 AM Defendant Taurus C Hill in court, in custody, with attorney Priya Barnes.   Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waukesha County Sheriff's Department Deputy Robert Faith sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Schmidt.  Cross examination by Attorney Barnes.  State rests.  State moves for bind over with argument.  Attorney Barnes objects to bind over with argument.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Attorney Barnes is asking for a quick date before the Trial Court.  Hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
